Package MOBLIMA

Class MovieSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • MOBLIMA.MovieSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MOBLIMASystem
    public class MovieSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements MOBLIMASystem
    Represents a controller system which keeps track of all movies.
    Since:
    2019-11-13
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    SS1 Group 2

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieSystem

        public MovieSystem()
        Constructor for the system. It attempts to deserialize the database file. If file does not exist, it will reset the database.

    • Method Detail

      • sortMovie

        public void sortMovie()
        Sorts the movies in the movie database based on movie title.

        Prints all the movie in the database, in alphabetical order.

        Prints all the movies given in an array list of movies.
        Parameters:
        array - array list of movies to be printed

      • listShowingMovies

        public boolean listShowingMovies()
        Prints all the movies that are showing.
        Returns:
        whether there is movie showing or not

      • getShowingMovies

        public java.util.ArrayList<Movie> getShowingMovies()
        Gets all the showing movies.
        Returns:
        array list of all showing movies

      • searchMovie

        public java.util.ArrayList<Movie> searchMovie​(java.lang.String s)
        Searches for a movie based on its title. The search mechanism is "contains" where one checks if one is substring of another, and is not case-sensitive. As such, one can search "LaDd" and "Aladdin" will appear.
        Parameters:
        s - substring to be searched for
        Returns:
        array list of movies which contains the substring

      • numMovies

        public int numMovies()
        Gets the number of movies in the database.
        Returns:
        number of movies in the database

      • selectShowingMovie

        public Movie selectShowingMovie​(java.util.ArrayList<Movie> array)
        Selector tool of movies in a given movie array list. Prints a list of movies, and user will have to select a movie using its index as printed.
        Parameters:
        array - the array list of movies
        Returns:
        movie if it exists, else null

      • selectShowingMovie

        public Movie selectShowingMovie()
        Selector tool of movies in database, only for movies which are showing. Prints a list of movies, and user will have to select a movie using its index as printed.
        Returns:
        movie if it exists, else null

      • getMovies

        public java.util.ArrayList<Movie> getMovies()
        Gets all movies in the database.
        Returns:
        array list of all movies in the database.

      • getMovie

        public Movie getMovie​(java.lang.String title)
        Gets a movie in database with exact title given.
        Parameters:
        title - title of the movie
        Returns:
        movie with corresponding title

      • getMovie

        public Movie getMovie​(int i)
        Gets a movie given its index in the database (index starts from 1).
        Parameters:
        i - index in the database
        Returns:
        movie corresponding to this index

      • addMovie

        public void addMovie​(Movie movie)
        Adds a movie into the database.
        Parameters:

      • deleteMovie

        public boolean deleteMovie​(int i)
        Deletes movie at given index in the database (index starts from 1).
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether deletion was successful

      • rankMoviebyBooking

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> rankMoviebyBooking()
        Get top 5 movies by ranking.
        Returns:
        a hash map of the ranking, where the key is the ranking (1, 2, 3, 4 and 5) and the value is an array list of the movie and its booking count

      • rankMoviebyRatings

        public java.util.ArrayList<Movie> rankMoviebyRatings()
        Get top 5 movies by ratings.
        Returns:
        array list of the top 5 movies, where the movies are sorted in descending order of rating

      • deserialize

        Specified by:

      • resetDatabase

        public boolean resetDatabase()
        Resets the movie database. It is preloaded with 6 different movies.
        Specified by:
        resetDatabase in interface MOBLIMASystem
        Returns:
        whether resetting the database is successful
